items.name: Claw-Forged Vessel
items.description: If you can dodge the dragons' breath of shadows, their claws might still take you.

items.name: Child's Vest

items.name: Child's Vest
items.description: I had to make do, even as I grew up among the Shadowfell's dark dangers.

items.name: Repaired Jerkin
items.description: I pieced this together to stay warm as I grew

items.name: Repaired Jerkin
items.description: With trophies from my battles, I remade my old vest, much as I remade myself.

data.backstory: Viconia DeVir is a devout cleric of Shar, the goddess of darkness and loss. Viconia was cast out of Menzoberranzan and house DeVir after refusing to sacrifice a child to the spider goddess Lolth. Don't mistake her for a champion of good, however. Viconia has lived a dangerous and difficult life, and she joins the Champions at the behest of two old 'friends', Baeloth & Minsc. She may not approve of how the Champions work, but she's here and ready to assist, so long as the quest, and the payout pleases her.

items.description: Purple and black are very much my colors.

items.name: Mantle of Eternal Night
items.description: Wrapped in Shar's purpose, I feel comfort and certainty.

data.backstory: Rust on the Harbour is a former pirate who gave up a life at sea because it was far too wet. Now trying life as an adventurer on land, he'll lend his roguish skills to anyone who can give him that which his heart desires most: one gold piece.

Rust has a $(loss_chance)% chance to accidentally lose the gold piece each time he attacks with his Rapier and a $(rust_cannonball_loss_chance)% chance to be lost during the Rust's 'Cannonball!' attack.

data.backstory: Artificer, entrepreneur, and planeswalker, the gnome Vi hails from the world of Eberron. Seeking to atone for her part in creating devastating weapons for the Last War, she established the Fixers, a business dedicated to fixing problems others deem unfixable. Born with an aberrant dragonmark that allows her to travel from one plane of existence to another, she's brought her genius, warm heart, and love for a stiff drink to many worlds. Headquartered in Sigil, the City of Doors, the Fixers now have offices throughout the multiverse.

data.backstory: Desmond stands an absolutely towering 5 foot 10 inches. He was inflicted with lycanthropy as a teenager on a hunt for food. While it's taken him a long time to do so, he's finally accepted his curse and savors any opportunity to unleash the beast inside if the situation arises... It often does.

data.backstory: Tatyana is an air-genasi barbarian gladiator, towering near seven feet tall, who earned her stripes in the fighting pits of Koshmarr. The talons of Falkovnia taught her the power of the bear totem, and the spirits of the mist connected her to the natural druidic world through the power of the moon. She is a fierce guardian of all who show her respect, is curious and bold, quick to fight but quick to forgive. Some see this giant blue weightless warrior as a bit of an 'air-head' but those who know this lightness comes from a deep knowledge that the moment is all we have, and death may lurk around any corner.

abilities.name: Rising Fury

description.desc: Each time $(source_hero) is attacked, she gains one Fury stack. The effect of Faithful Friend is increased by $(amount)% for each Fury stack, stacking additively and then applying multiplicatively. She loses $(amount___2)% of her Fury stacks every $(time___2) seconds that she is not attacked. Caps at $(max_stacks) stacks.

abilities.desc: Each time Tatyana is attacked, she gains one Fury stack. The effect of Faithful Friend is increased by 100% for each Fury stack, stacking additively and then applying multiplicatively. She loses 10% of her Fury stacks every 15 seconds that she is not attacked. Caps at 150 stacks.

abilities.name: Find a Feast

raw.tip_text: If Tatyana has not been attacked recently she grabs some snacks and brings back some extra enemies to fight
raw.name: Find a Feast

description.pre: If $(source_hero) is not attacked for $(time) seconds, and the players are in a non-boss area with no barriers, she briefly runs ahead off the right side of the screen. She returns $(offscreen_time) seconds later from the right side with $(tatyana_find_a_feast_range) additional enemies that simultaneously spawn. After she returns, the $(time) seconds counter starts again from 0 seconds.

conditions.desc: ^^Minimum Enemies spawned: $(tatyana_find_a_feast_range_min)^Chance of Additional Enemy: $(tatyana_find_a_feast_range_extra_chance)%

abilities.desc: If Tatyana has not been attacked recently she grabs some snacks and brings back some extra enemies to fight.

abilities.name: Rage

description.desc: When $(source_hero) reaches $(amount___2)+ Fury stacks, and for every $(time___2) seconds she's above $(amount___2)+ Fury stacks, she gets a Rage stack, up to $(max_stacks) Rage stacks. With at least 1 Rage stack, she rages and her base attack changes. For each Rage stack, Faithful Friend gets a $(amount)% bonus, stacking multiplicatively. If she goes below $(amount___2) Fury stacks, she loses all Rage stacks.

abilities.desc: When Tatyana reaches 50+ Fury stacks, and for every 15 seconds she's above 50+ Fury stacks, she gets a Rage stack, up to 6 Rage stacks. With at least 1 Rage stack, she rages and her base attack changes. For each Rage stack, Faithful Friend gets a 400% bonus, stacking multiplicatively. If she goes below 50 Fury stacks, she loses all Rage stacks.

specs.name: Best Friend Forever

raw.name: Best Friend Forever
raw.specialization_description: Tatyana focuses on her only friend

description.desc: $(source_hero)'s Faithful Friend continues to only affect one slot, however the effect is increased by $(amount)%.

specs.desc: Tatyana's Faithful Friend continues to only affect one slot, however the effect is increased by 400%.

ult.long_description: A stripe of entangling roots appears to the right of the front column, dealing damage to all enemies inside it, and all enemies that enter it during its duration. Enemies standing in the roots deal 50% less damage. The roots last for 30 seconds.

data.backstory: Gazrick Nomrad is just your standard gnome druid/businessman/detective/chef/socialist construct. Harnessing the magic of all things cold, he brings a wealth of frost-based spells to the table, as well as insisting his actions are not weird. They are.

abilities.name: Frosty Friendship

raw.tip_text: Gazrick buffs all Champions in a unique snowflake formation
raw.name: Frosty Friendship

description.pre: $(source_hero) increases the damage of all Champions in a snowflake shape. The damage bonus depends on how far away they are from $(source_hero), with the effect increasing for each slot.

conditions.desc: ^^Bonuses By Distance:^$gazrick_forsty_friendship_table

abilities.desc: Gazrick buffs all Champions in a unique snowflake formation.

abilities.name: Travelling Merchant

description.desc: $(source_hero) now travels with a portable stall to sell his merch. Increase the gold find bonus by $(not_buffed amount)% for each Rivals of Waterdeep member in the formation, including himself.

abilities.desc: Gazrick now travels with a portable stall to sell his merch. Increase the gold find bonus by 100% for each Rivals of Waterdeep member in the formation, including himself.

abilities.name: Armor Ablation

raw.tip_text: Gazrick reduces the amount of damage required to destroy a section of armor from an armored enemy
raw.name: Armor Ablation

description.desc: $(source_hero)'s cold attacks lowers an enemy's armor threshold by $(amount___2)% for $(amount) seconds. Only applies to armored enemies. Stacks up to $(max_ablation_stacks) times, but each stack tracks its own duration.

abilities.desc: Gazrick reduces the amount of damage required to destroy a section of armor from an armored enemy.

description.desc: $(source_hero) causes enemies to take an additional $(amount)% damage in areas where it is snowing.

ult.description: Gazrick summons a sleet storm above the nearest enemy dealing damage and freezing the ground in a large AOE radius.
ult.long_description: Gazrick summons a sleet storm above the nearest enemy dealing damage and freezing the ground in a large AOE radius. The frozen ground lasts for 30 seconds slowing enemies by 50% while they travel through it. If not already snowing, it begins to snow until the area changes.

base.description: Gazrick attacks the closest enemy with magic dealing damage with a chance to stun them.
base.long_description: Gazrick attacks the closest enemy with a magic attack that causes one hit and a 50% chance that the enemy is stunned for 2 seconds.

data.backstory: He is Dungeon Master, your guide in the realm of Dungeons & Dragons!

abilities.name: Dungeon Master Rules

description.desc: $(source_hero) is eligible to start in all adventures, even if the Patron, Variant, or other restrictions would say otherwise.

abilities.desc: Dungeon Master is eligible to start in all adventures, even if the Patron, Variant, or other restrictions would say otherwise.

raw.name: Patience, Young Ones!

description.desc: $(source_hero) increases the damage of all Champions by $(not_buffed amount)% for each Champion in the formation that is 20 years or younger, stacking multiplicatively. If the sum of the $(not_buffed num_of_youngest___2) youngest Champions' ages is $(not_buffed max_age_sum___2) years or less, the bonus is increased by $(amount___2)% (post-stack).

description.desc: Upon entering a new Area, there is a $(chance)% chance that $(source_hero) does not appear in the formation and is replaced by a frightened Uni the Unicorn. While $(source_hero) is away, the formation's gold find is increased by $(amount)%. If you return to a previously completed area, $(source_hero) is always with the formation.

data.backstory: Modrons are the embodiment of law and order, marching in lockstep through the planes. But when Nordom Whistlklik was separated from his fellow modrons, the essence of chaos infected this rogue quadrone. Now with his crossbow-shaped gear spirits in hand, he works to fit his complex new outlook into his logical—if quirky—understanding of the planes.

data.backstory: Merilwen is the Wood Elf Druid with a penchant for puns and powerful spells. Her trusty bow can help her out of many a tough situation, but she finds that turning into a cat can be just as useful. Oh and she might look cute, but don't underestimate her; fiercely loyal to her friends, and to nature itself, she'll call upon the moon to deal with anyone who gets on her bad side. And if you're really unlucky, you might stumble into Merilwen's Meatgrinder. Spoilers: it's a very bad time.

If there are ever $(monster_limit___2) or more enemies on the screen, $(source_hero) transforms back to her normal form and starts attacking until the party switches areas.

data.backstory: Nahara is a reborn fallen Aasimar undead warlock/college of the spirits bard. She fell into the mists of Ravenloft unable to remember anything from her life (or past lives as we’ve come to learn). All she knows is that her current Patron, Azalin Rex, has asked her to aid him against his foe Strahd von Zarovich, who for reasons unknown to her, has been desperately seeking her out.

data.backstory: Valentine comes from a life of leisure. Once a social butterfly, nightlife connoisseur, and princess of the shady family business but that life ended in sudden tragedy. Through the mysterious will of Bluetspur, Valentine was given a second chance at life, though no miracle comes without consequence. Now she wanders the domains of dread with her companion Tatyana, in search of purpose and power.

data.backstory: A young Eladrin woman, raised to be the Queen of Koshmarr, what was meant to be an idyllic life took a dark turn on the night of her wedding. Pulled into the machinations of greater powers, she found herself in Mordent, now one of the many wandering ghosts. A person of great interest both to Azalin Rex and Strahd, she sought to negotiate her freedom from these dread domains. Her longtime companions and their newfound friends wanted the same and imbued her soul into Desmond's sword. As they traveled in search of returning her soul to her body, Voronika took matters into her own hands and used the crown of the Raven Queen to defeat Zybilna and cause the fall of Prismeer. This action drew the mists to Voronika and soon she discovered herself a new darklord in her domain of Koshmarr.

data.backstory: Dob is an enthusiastic, energetic music-maker who never lets a little thing like 'not having a plan' stand in the way of action. His sister, Suzette, raised him. When he fell ill, she attempted various, wild cures leaving Dob with a permanent, lurid green hue to his skin. Dob became a traveling bard, self-taught in music and magic. This brought him into contact with the Oxventurers, with whom he shares many bizarre adventures. Accomplished and charismatic, this bard favours lulling enemies to sleep or hard-rocking spell attacks with acrobatic combat. Dob also carries Ethelfrith's Hammer, a cursed weapon with the power to summon 60 obedient skeletons, but exacts a heavy price for doing so.

Number of Deposit stacks is capped at $(deposit_stack_cap_mult) times the highest area completed in the current adventure.

data.backstory: Blooshi isn’t like other bullywugs—she’s dark. Nobody understands this teen, but when she picked up a strange skull, she found someone who does: an undead entity who sealed her in a warlock pact. Now whenever she dies she comes back as a much tougher ghost, smashing her assailants before being sucked back into her body and returning to life. Very useful and goes with her whole, like, vibe. Surely there will be no repercussions!

(Boss enemies instead give her $(boss_stacks) Soul Stacks.) $(source_hero) increases the damage of Champions in the two columns behind her by $(amount)% for each Soul stack, stacking additively. When changing areas, she loses 20% of her Soul stacks.

data.backstory: Clumsy but well-meaning, Egbert the Dragonborn Paladin was summarily booted out of his Paladin order after a terrible incident he doesn't like to talk about. Setting out on his quest for atonement with a new deity in tow, La Vache Mauve, he falls in with the Oxventurers Guild and, by his reckoning, questing with them offers as good a chance as any of guiding him towards absolution. Often impulsive, he very rarely plans beyond his initial moment of 'inspiration' but his heart's in the right place. Well, at least until he next rushes into battle, trips into a spike pit and ends up kebabbed on a skewer...

data.backstory: A former archaeologist turned adventurer, Kentucky 'Kent' Jones honed his skills exploring a temple of Talona, goddess of poison and plague. While his team didn't survive the temple's defenses, he returned home to the lakeside town of Caradoon. Still a flamboyant Tiefling, Kent carries a darkness that he does his best to keep hidden. But he doesn't bear the darkness alone. After returning to Caradoon, he met smart and PATIENT Aasimar, Virgil. Together they've flourished, even after accidentally poisoning the ground under a local tavern in an effort to get rid of a few rats and fleeing Caradoon only to meet up with Selise Astorio and join the Rivals.

data.backstory: With an unexpected Celestial and magical heritage, Virgil Zoar was always traveling to get away from both his past and a disapproving family. He put his talents to work on the sea, traveling with crews who he hoped would ask nothing more than that he earn his keep by way of his Storm sorcery. One day, tired of wandering, he ended up in the quiet lakeside town of Caradoon, thinking he might put down roots. But that all changed when he met and fell for a kindred spirit in the form of a charming and witty tiefling named Kent. After some over-enthusiastic handling of the local tavern's rat problem, they found themselves on the move again, met up with Selise Astorio of the Rivals of Waterdeep, becoming quickly entangled in the group's adventures, and realizing that they had found a new family and a new home.

description.pre: Virgil gains a Weather stack each time the weather changes when advancing to a new area or when it's changed by an ultimate attack or other ability. Virgil tracks each type of weather in a separate stack. Each stack is multiplied by $(stack_mult_percent)% and then all stacks are multiplied together to get a total value which increases the damage of all Champions. Each stack caps at $(max_stacks_per_weather_type).

items.name: Gifted Glass
items.description: Thank you for this... it's very... pretty? I like the way it... um... shines?

items.name: Kent's Attempt
items.description: I know Kent means well, but I gave him my heart. He gave me a piece of glass.

items.name: Brilliance in Circular Form
items.description: What I MEANT is we'd always find each other. Still... I'll never lose Kent.

items.name: Symbol of Our Bond
items.description: A ring is insufficient to describe our love, yet a perfect symbol of our bond.

items.name: Worn-Out Threads
items.description: When you leave your past behind, sometimes starting over means sacrificing.

items.name: Serviceable Shirt
items.description: This is what happens when you wear the same shirt day after day on the sea.

items.name: Tailored Finery
items.description: That's more like it. Bonus: It no longer smells like the sea!

items.name: Matching Glamour
items.description: This goes with Kent's coat. I actually never wear this, but the thought's sweet.

items.name: Battered Cuffs
items.description: The salt air wore these down.

items.name: Stowing Bracers
items.description: Look! They have pockets!

items.name: Leather Bracers
items.description: When they come in close, I'm ready for them.

items.name: Bracers of Defense
items.description: For something so delicate, these can absorb a lot of damage. Sounds familiar.

items.name: Makeshift Breeze
items.description: I made this out of the wanted ad for my first job. 'Magic Guy Needed.'

items.name: Painted Fan
items.description: I thought this would be for the heat, but honestly the sea smells. A lot.

items.name: Sharp-Edged Fan
items.description: Fashion, function, fanning! Get yourself an accessory that can do it all.

items.name: Bladed Fan of Rebuke
items.description: Targets acquired. Kent and other Rivals accounted for. Chain Lightning time!

items.name: Pocket journal
items.description: I like a place to jot down my thoughts.

items.name: Notebook of Memories
items.description: I started this back when I arrived at Caradoon. So much has changed since then.

items.name: Virgil's Diary
items.description: Hold on a minute, I want to finish this entry. Is "Greatwyrm" one word or two?

items.name: Thrilling Memoirs
items.description: All our adventures together are contained in this book. Well...most of them.

items.name: Leaky Waders
items.description: I don't care if they're stylish, no one wants wet feet.

items.name: Boggy Boots
items.description: At sea, best be prepared for all weather. Especially when you're a storm sorcerer.

items.name: Watertight Gear
items.description: Look... one of us is going to look foolish when we get through this storm.

items.name: Battle-Ready Harness
items.description: There's space for all my components and weapons. And above all, my style.

data.backstory: Warduke's services as a remorseless killer-for-hire can be easily bought. The evil swordsman isn't terribly bright, which is why he leaves the plotting and scheming to others. He just likes to hit things with his sword.

abilities.name: A Trained Killer

raw.name: A Trained Killer

description.desc: Each time $(source_hero) attacks or is damaged, he gains a Remorseless stack. $(source_hero) increases his damage by $(amount)% for each Remorseless stack he has, stacking additively. Stacks are reset when traveling to a new area.

items.description: Bah! I need no protection!

items.name: Amulet of Healing

data.backstory: Imoen is a surprisingly cheerful young woman considering she eventually discovered that she was the child of a deadly murder god. As an orphan, she moved to Candlekeep at the age of 10 with her adoptive father and innkeeper, Winthrop. She eventually traveled to Baldur's Gate with a childhood friend, where she joined forces with powerful Champions like Minsc and Jaheira.

items.name: Trickster's Armor

data.backstory: Fen is a Drow Dhampir Warlock with a touch of mischief and sneakiness. She's loyal to those she cares for, a fearsome opponent for those who have earned her hate. Above all else, everything she's done has been for Isolde's freedom. Now she needs a new purpose to fight for, and maybe she can find it among the Society.

data.backstory: Brother Uriah Macawber is a native of Ravenloft, born in the dread domain of Darkon under the iron rule of Azalin Rex. After a horrifying childhood encounter at the Carnival with the demonic entity known as The Caller, Uriah would embrace the worship of the goddess Ezra, Lady of the Mists, offering protection from the forces of darkness to all those in need. Upon joining with the other future members of The Black Dice Society at the infamous House of Lament, Uriah would go on to find true love with his teammate, the undead Aasimar, Nahara... and would eventually discover the dark truth of both the nature of his deity and his mysterious connection to his former liege, the lich-king Azalin Rex.

data.backstory: Being telepathic means Solaak knows who to trust–and that’s not many people. But when the kalashtar finds the soul of a dragon trapped in a chasm, they form a bond of trust like no other. Solaak rides their dragon mentor, Tempest, into battle, unstoppable together.

abilities.name: Drakewarden

description.desc: $(source_hero)'s pet pseudodragon Levits takes $(source_hero)'s slot in the formation while $(source_hero) rides his drake companion, Tempest, into battle. He attacks from Tempest. If Levits is knocked out by enemies, $(source_hero) and Tempest retreat from the battlefield until you change areas.

abilities.desc: Solaak's pet pseudodragon Levits takes Solaak's slot in the formation while Solaak rides his drake companion, Tempest, into battle. He attacks from Tempest. If Levits is knocked out by enemies, Solaak and Tempest retreat from the battlefield until you change areas.

data.backstory: Miria Elithren is a Shadar Kai Silvanesti Elf from the world of Krynn. Born under an ill-omen of the Dark Moon, Nuitari, she had an unhappy childhood that caused her to flee her homeland and seek tutelage in advanced magical arts beyond Elven lands. After passing the Test of High Sorcery, she briefly allied with Lord Soth until he tried to turn Miria into an undead creature subservient to his will. Miria escaped Soth's trap at the cost of the flesh and muscle of her right arm. Pursued by Soth for her arcane knowledge, Miria seeks to escape Krynn.

abilities.name: Mage of High Sorcery

raw.tip_text: Miria increases the damage of Champions adjacent to her, keep her next to your highest damage dealing champions.
raw.name: Mage of High Sorcery

When a Champion in that column takes damage, the Zombie Bodyguard takes $(amount)% of the damage instead, while the original target takes the remaining $(miria_zombie_bodyguards_remaining_amount)%.

description.desc: $(source_hero) maintains a stash of clones in her Inner Sanctum with a count equal to her Soul Cage stacks. If $(source_hero) is defeated, a clone immediately appears and takes her place at full health. This does not reduce the number of Soul Cage stacks she has. Her stash of clones are regenerated when the party changes areas. For each clone summoned in the current area, the effect of $(upgrade_name id) is increased by $(not_buffed amount)%, stacking multiplicatively.

data.backstory: Antrius is your classic fantasy Bard - he's a lover, not a fighter. After his supportive parents paid his way through Bard College, Antrius is out on the road trying to make a name for himself. With a glorious mane of hair and his lute, he is ready to charm anyone who gets in the party's way, friend or foe. His golden pipes bring inspiration to all who hear his song!

abilities.name: Inspiring Song

raw.tip_text: Antrius protects and buffs adjacent Champions.
raw.name: Inspiring Song

effect_keys.override_key_desc: $target is granted $amount temporary HP every $(interval) seconds. The total temporary HP can only grant up to $optional_percent_limit% of $target's max HP

description.desc: $(source_hero) inspires each adjacent Champion giving them $(amount___2) temporary hit points every $(interval___2) seconds and increasing their damage by $(amount)%. Any Champion with a Charisma score of 17 or higher further inspires all unaffected adjacent Champions, and this continues to cascade. $(source_hero)' song is so inspiring that he also inspires himself. The total shield amount on each Champion is limited to 10 times the Champion's max health.

data.backstory: Nixie is a charismatic tiefling that brings a chaotic element to the party. Growing up in a wealthy but oppressive household, Nixie was punished for using magic despite her natural talent. In a rebellious move, she stole the family grimoire to teach herself dark sorcery only to result in the burning down of her family manor and all her family inside. Despite this tragedy, Nixie is now on a journey to enjoy her newfound magical freedom and find a new family. When confronted by enemies, and occasionally even friends, she's always ready to hurl her favorite spell, Fireball, with unbridled enthusiasm.

abilities.name: Blazing Charisma

conditions.desc: ^^Engulfing Flames - $(source_hero) lights the area of her attack on fire for 20 seconds. While lit, it deals $(seconds_plural amount___2) of BUD to enemies in the effect each second.^Potted Punch - $(source_hero) turns into a potted plant for 5 seconds and can't attack, increasing the damage bonus of $(upgrade_name id___5) by $(amount___5)% while in that form, and for 15 additional seconds afterwards.^Coin Cascade - Gold coins also fly out from her attack's explosion, worth $(amount___6)% of a normal monster kill.^Shockwave - $(source_hero)'s attack also sends out a shockwave that stuns Monsters in the attack's area for $(seconds_plural amount___7).^Feeling Blue - $(source_hero)'s skin turns blue for 10 seconds.^Eldritch Entourage - A random monster is summoned.^Enlarge - $(source_hero)'s size increases. Her damage also increases by $(amount___11)% for 20 seconds.

items.name: Old Bandages
items.description: These have maybe one or two more Burning Hands before they're done...

items.name: New-ish Arm Wrappings
items.description: I found these on a dead guard - I mean bandit. Yeah, it was a bandit.

items.name: Heroic Present
items.description: Marquis gave me these in exchange for not setting his manor on fire.

items.name: Fireproof Arm Coverings
items.description: I can't burn these?! Let me try - FIREBALL!

items.name: Adventurer's Cape
items.description: I can do so many cool poses in this! Check out this one! Now this one!

items.name: Flamboyant Cape
items.description: Look what it does when I spin - wheeeeeee!

items.name: Carnival Shawl
items.description: I got this one in the Witchlight Carnival when I was a Bearowl trainer!

items.name: Magic Cloak
items.description: This cloak is magic! I don't know what it does, but it's magic!

items.name: Simple Earrings
items.description: Wild Magic turned two merchants into these. They're prettier now!

items.name: Pretty Earrings
items.description: Aren't these cute? You should see them when I cast fireball - they get extra shiny.

items.name: Crystal Necklace
items.description: No, I didn't steal this crystal from the Minotaurium Emporium - I would never!

items.name: Scorching Brooch
items.description: This makes my fire burn things more. I guess that's as good as another fireball?

items.name: Manor Ribbon
items.description: The only thing I have from my family's manor that burned down. It wasn't me.

items.name: Replacement Ribbon
items.description: The last one burned up. Hey, just like the manor!

items.name: Pretty Bow
items.description: Evandra says it looks stupid, but she's what's stupid!

items.name: Fancy Noisemaker
items.description: Okay, I DID steal this one...

items.name: Silver Fire Necklace
items.description: What do you mean it doesn't cast FIREBALL?!

items.name: Fireball-like Necklace
items.description: If something looks like a fireball... THEN IT SHOULD CAST FIREBALL!

items.name: Ball of Fire Amulet
items.description: FIRE. BALL. What don't you understand about this?

items.name: Talisman of Fireball
items.description: Fireball! Fireball! FIREBALL! FINALLY - AHAHAH!

items.name: Random Components
items.description: All of these are flammable - so they help me cast Fireball, right?

items.name: Fresh Ingredients
items.description: These taste like crap.

items.name: Quality Components
items.description: The dying wizard was all like, 'No, stop. They're for the students.' Psh. Weirdo.

items.name: Pyromancer's Holster
items.description: I have everything I need! Bat guano. Sulfur. It's all here!

data.backstory: Rough and tumble, and ready for action, half-elven Fighter Evandra brings the muscle. Evandra ran away from home when her father discovered that she had been training in strength and combat. He tried to force her into an arranged marriage with an elven nobleman, but Evandra rejected this on both principle and taste. She decided instead to become an adventurer, free from her father's judgment.

abilities.name: Evandra, the Magnificent

description.desc: $(source_hero) can be used in any Wild Beyond the Witchlight campaign adventure or variant, even if she would not normally be available to be used due to variant or patron restrictions.

abilities.desc: Evandra can be used in any Wild Beyond the Witchlight campaign adventure or variant, even if she would not normally be available to be used due to variant or patron restrictions.

abilities.name: Freedom's Fury

raw.tip_text: Evandra buffs Neutral Champions on the Good / Evil axis. Try using Lawful and Chaotic Neutral Champions with her.
raw.name: Freedom's Fury

description.desc: $(source_hero) increases the damage of all Neutral (Good/Evil axis) Champions by $(amount)%.

abilities.desc: Evandra buffs Neutral Champions on the Good / Evil axis. Try using Lawful and Chaotic Neutral Champions with her.

abilities.name: Never Completely 'Armless

raw.tip_text: The first time Evandra would otherwise die in an area, she merely loses and arm and returns to full health.
raw.name: Never Completely 'Armless

description.desc: When $(source_hero)'s health is brought to zero, she loses her left arm but returns to full health. Her arm regrows after moving to a new area. While missing her arm, she increases the damage bonus of $(upgrade_name id___3) by $(not_buffed amount___2)% for each second she had her arm in the current area, stacking additively and being applied multiplicatively.

abilities.desc: The first time Evandra would otherwise die in an area, she merely loses and arm and returns to full health.

This bonus resets when an enemy is defeated.

abilities.desc:
Increases the formation's gold find by 100%. Every time a Champion attacks but does not defeat an enemy, increase this bonus by 50%, stacking additively up to 120 times and applying multiplicatively. This bonus resets when an enemy is defeated.
>

specs.desc: Evandra increases the damage bonus of Freedom's Fury by 400% for each Champion with a total ability score of 78 or less in the formation, stacking multiplicatively, and all Awful Ones Champions can be used in Witchlight adventures.

ult.description: Evandra disarms a mechanical guard. She uses the guard's arm as a weapon for the next 15 seconds and gains some additional effects for the duration
ult.long_description: A mechanical guard charges toward the party. Evandra moves up, attacks the guard, and instantly "disarms" it and defeats it. Evandra uses the guard's arm as a weapon for the next 15 seconds instead of her sword. For the duration, Evandra's attack deals an additional 3 seconds of BUD damage, her normal attack speed cooldown is faster by 2 seconds, and Freedom's Fury is increased by 100% for the duration.
ult.name: Improvised Arms

base.description: Evandra moves up next to the closest enemy and swings her sword, dealing 1 hit to all nearby enemies.

items.name: Faux Fur Collar
items.description: Of course it's fake - do you know how much stuff like this costs?

items.name: Low-Quality Fur Collar
items.description: Made this one myself. There are only a few holes and burn marks on it.

items.name: Dire Fox Skin
items.description: It may look like it was adorable, but it nearly took my arm off! ...again.

items.name: Living Collar
items.description: Bandits are very surprised when this comes to life and bites their throats.

items.name: Borrowed Armor
items.description: Those guys were already dead when we found them in the alley.

items.name: Improved Armor
items.description: Can you believe this was just lying around in a house we broke into?

items.name: Heroic Outfit
items.description: Oh, I could totally strangle someone with this cape!

items.name: Armor of Victory
items.description: Won this at a jousting tourney. No thanks to Dargle-bark.

items.name: Rented Blade
items.description: I checked this out in Stormwood. They didn't even ask for collateral!

items.name: Bandit Sword
items.description: These bandits were strange. 'No, we're guards!' Barely fought back.

items.name: Trusty Long Sword
items.description: I've cut off SO many heads with this baby.

items.name: Blade of Vengeance
items.description: This sword was forged to kill me, but I killed them first! Easy fight, really.

items.name: Unknown Fang
items.description: Nixie stole this at some point. No idea what it is, but it looks kinda cool.

items.name: Orc Tooth
items.description: Got this off Mogdar during a battle of strength. He says he didn't agree to it.

items.name: Bearowl Trophy
items.description: Dargle-bark as a bearowl is really annoying - so I took this to shut him up.

items.name: Necklace of Fury
items.description: Pulled this off an eldritch beast after I fell through a portal. No big deal.

items.name: Dirty Horn
items.description: Found this on a dead guard. Don't ask what else I found...

items.name: Travel Mead Horn
items.description: Got this on discount after threatening the merchant's family.

items.name: Rejuvenating Kantsi
items.description: Lorienne blessed this horn to heal me in battle! But it only heals 1 hp...

items.name: Horn of the Infinite
items.description: This horn never runs out of ale! I don't remember two tendays after getting it!

items.name: Evandra's Left Arm
items.description: No big deal. I'll just get Vlithryn to fix it.

items.name: Preserved Limb
items.description: Vlithryn didn't fix it... She just screeched and walked away. Very rude.

items.name: Mechanical Arm
items.description: I've beaten so many guards with this. Really gets the anger out.

items.name: Head of the Gnoll King
items.description: Got a wizard to make it stop decaying because it looks cool on my belt.

data.backstory: BBEG is the Big Bad Evil Guy brought to life by Pat, the DM of the Awful Ones. This drow necromancer believes immaculate planning will always lead to success, but his constant failures contradict this conviction. BBEG likes to monologue and taunt his opponents, leaving his summoned zombies to engage directly in combat.

abilities.name: Awful Nemesis

description.desc: As the sworn enemy of the Awful Ones, $source is eligible for any adventure that any of them are eligible for. However, they still don't remember who he is.

abilities.desc: As the sworn enemy of the Awful Ones, BBEG is eligible for any adventure that any of them are eligible for. However, they still don't remember who he is.

abilities.name: Evil Overlord

raw.tip_text: BBEG increases the damage of all Champions with an INT score of 12 or less.

abilities.desc: BBEG increases the damage of all Champions with an INT score of 12 or less.

abilities.desc: The time it takes for Rise, My Minions! to summon a zombie is reduced by 2.5 seconds for each Awful Ones affiliation member in the formation, and the damage bonus of Evil Overlord is increased by 25% for each summoned zombie, stacking multiplicatively, with buffs applying to the pre-stack value.

items.name: Ritual Athame
items.description: This was the dagger he used to start his journey of evil.

items.name: Stained Dagger
items.description: The blood that stains this dagger imbues it with evil magic.

items.name: Necrotic Cleaver
items.description: 'This blade has killed many innocents,' he says with an evil laugh.

items.name: Deathfrost
items.description: You see a sword glowing with evil runes and a skull crossguard. It's badass.

items.name: Borrowed Screen
items.description: Yeah, I guess I could give this DM thing a try.

items.name: Updated Screen
items.description: This is full of sticky notes now.

items.name: Hand Made Kit
items.description: I actually made this all by myself. Yes, that is tape painted to look like wood.

items.name: Barrier of Meta Protection
items.description: It has tiny catapults to throw things at players when they sneak a peek.

items.name: Annoying Skull
items.description: He didn't always have an undead army. He started with just a talking skull.

items.name: Undead Advisor
items.description: One day the skull began talking about Balgronuuth, and he listened intently.

items.name: Skeletal Herald
items.description: 'My master will usher in the reign of Balgronuuth!' The herald begins to glow.

items.name: Zarxox, Undead General
items.description: 'You should serve my master,' says the general. 'Great dental plan for biting.'

items.name: Old Notebook
items.description: I just had this laying around. It'll do the job.

items.name: Story Journal
items.description: Don't touch! This has all my brilliant ideas in it - they're secret!

items.name: Book from E'tsyy
items.description: Look, I didn't know how to bind a book and this one was the coolest online.

items.name: Omniscient Tome
items.description: 'With this tome I will finally release Balgronuuth and destroy this realm!'

items.name: Starter Kit Die
items.description: Oh, it comes with dice. These will do until I get some nice ones.

items.name: DM's Die
items.description: DO NOT TOUCH THIS D20! YOU'LL JUST CURSE IT!

items.name: Metal D20
items.description: Wow, these edges are pretty sharp...

items.name: Die of 1 for All
items.description: Oh, here Eva, you can use my D20 for the save.

items.name: Backstory Plate
items.description: This was his brother's. The players don't need to know he killed his brother.

items.name: Inconspicuous NPC Armor
items.description: No, no, he's just a normal NPC that needs to be escorted somewhere.

items.name: Not-the-Villain Plate
items.description: I totally never, ever, expected this NPC to be part of the story - nope.

items.name: Armor of the Plot
items.description: HOW MUCH DAMAGE?! I mean, haha! He has immunity to that type of damage!

data.backstory: Strongheart is a fearless seeker of justice, risking his life to ensure that good triumphs over evil. He is thoughtful, kind, and seldom rash, yet never hesitant to punish those who spit in the face of law and order.

items.name: Training Dagger
items.description: We all must start our adventure somewhere.

items.name: Guard's Weapon
items.description: It's not much, but it has saved me on countless occasions.

items.name: Blade of the Paladin
items.description: I pledge myself to your service. It is an honor to fight by your side.

items.name: Heart of Gold Hammer
items.description: This once helped a band of brave adventurers escape the Prison of Agony.

items.name: Winged Cap
items.description: This was my first cap, and only because it was all they had left.

items.name: Guard's Helmet
items.description: I found myself fond of the wings and kept them as a guard.

items.name: Winged Helm
items.description: Gifted to me by a dear friend in lands far from here.

items.name: Helm of Celestial Wings
items.description: I never thought I would soar through clouds -- until I found this.

items.name: Chainmail
items.description: This stopped more blades than it should have been able to.

items.name: Enhanced Mail
items.description: Enchanted by an elven cleric in the forests of Icewind Dale.

items.name: Plate Armor
items.description: Armor is only as good as the knight who wears it.

items.name: Word of Honor Plate
items.description: A promise was made when this was crafted. I will honor it forever.

items.name: Armor Polish
items.description: Armor doesn't clean itself after all. Well, unless you're a wizard I suppose.

items.name: Scented Polish
items.description: I stood in line for four hours in the Neverwinter market for this.

items.name: Draconic Soap
items.description: This was made for me by a bronze dragon. It never runs out!

items.name: Enchanted Mustache Wax
items.description: There's no reason one can't look fabulous on the battlefield!

items.name: Hempen Rope
items.description: Some scoff at always having rope with you. They're fools.

items.name: Unbreakable Rope
items.description: This has gotten me out of quite a few binds.

items.name: Collapsible Pole
items.description: The best advice I can give you is to ALWAYS have this in your adventuring pack.

items.name: Portable Ram
items.description: No villain can hide with this at my side.

items.name: Horse Grooming Kit
items.description: A knight's horse should be as clean as they are.

items.name: Expert Grooming Kit
items.description: My steed likes the extra care, so it's worth the extra coin to me.

items.name: Trusty Saddle
items.description: You should trust your saddle as much as your horse.

items.name: Mystic Horse Armor
items.description: A trusty steed deserves a set of trusty armor.

data.backstory: Vin Ursa is one of the deadliest bounty hunters in Wildspace. Raised by autognome thieves and trained by a former Xaryxian assassin, Vin has all the skills she needs to get the job done. To keep those skills honed, she spends much of her off time in the Arena of Blood. If there's one thing you should hope for in Wildspace, it's to avoid ending up on the wrong side of her L.A.S.E.R. sight. She's built her renown fighting some of the most terrifying creatures this side of the Abyss and has a long list of Favored Foes to show for it.

abilities.name: Wildspace Lover

description.desc: $source can be used in any Light of Xaryxis campaign adventure or variant, even if she would not normally be available to be used due to variant or patron restrictions.

abilities.desc: Vin Ursa can be used in any Light of Xaryxis campaign adventure or variant, even if she would not normally be available to be used due to variant or patron restrictions.

abilities.name: Bounty Hunter

raw.tip_text: Vin Ursa picks a random monster type as her favored foe. She can add additional Favored Foe types by using her ultimate ability.

ult.long_description: Vin Ursa blasts an enemy. She has a +20% chance to score a critical hit and the enemy becomes a favored foe if she crits.

base.description: Vin Ursa uses her Light Accelerating Spectral Energy Relay to attack a random enemy.

Increases the damage of all Nonbinary Champions by 200%.
Increases the damage of all Champions by 10% for each Champion in the formation.

items.name: Traveler's Fedora
items.description: Someone told me bounty hunters wear hats. This is what I could afford.

items.name: Lucky Cap
items.description: There are a few more ray gun marks than I thought on this...

items.name: Bounty Hunter Hat
items.description: Someone ran at the sight of my hat. It was awesome! I have a look now!

items.name: Hat of Disguise
items.description: For when you need a new face. Or a face at all.

items.name: Security Coat
items.description: Nicked this off a guard who wasn't looking. It's got armor inside!

items.name: Well Worn Coat
items.description: I genuinely cannot believe how many hits this coat has taken.

items.name: Plasmoid Jacket
items.description: I found a plasmoid tailor to make this for me. They knew how to keep me flowing.

items.name: Cloak of Stars and Darkness
items.description: This lets me seep into the shadows and also watches my back for me.

items.name: Compact Wrist Bow
items.description: I can't afford anything better -- so this will have to do.

items.name: Dead Eye Crossbow
items.description: I'm way better with this thing than I should be.

items.name: L.A.S.E.R. Wrist Array
items.description: This thing is so cool! Is it too cool for me? Ah! It's so cool!

items.name: Starstrike Array
items.description: This was specially designed for me by my dad. It was the last thing he made.

items.name: Heist Score
items.description: This was our last score before the team was wiped out...

items.name: Remaining Stash
items.description: There's not much of this left. I need more contracts. Fast.

items.name: Family Gears
items.description: Each of these comes from a member of my autognome family.

items.name: Arena of Blood Coin
items.description: Old Vocath looked really annoyed when he had to present this to me.

items.name: Happy Beholder Mug
items.description: You'd be surprised how many bounties just walk into a tavern you're already in.

items.name: Replacement Mug
items.description: I broke the last one over a giff's head. Got this one for free from Large Luigi.

items.name: Goblinpunk Stein
items.description: Have you been to Eberron? That place is WILD!

items.name: Infinity's Souvenir
items.description: I just found this place, and I never wanted to leave. SO MANY TAVERNS!

items.name: Active Bounty
items.description: Until I'm in a guild, these will have to do for contracts.

items.name: First Bounty Poster
items.description: I still hang onto this all these years later.

items.name: Wildspace Scrying Stone
items.description: Wildspace is REALLY big. This helps me find a bounty anywhere.

items.name: Dimensional Shackles
items.description: Some bounties require assurance that they stay on this plane.

data.backstory: Lae'zel is a ferocious Githyanki warrior, mighty even by the standards of her mind flayer-hunting kind. Faced with transforming into the very monster she's sworn to destroy, Lae'zel must prove herself worthy of rejoining her people - if they don't execute her first.

abilities.name: Critical Hit

description.desc: $source's base chance to Critical Hit is $(amount)%.

abilities.desc: Lae'zel's base chance to Critical Hit is 20%.

abilities.name: Lethal Coordination

raw.tip_text: Lae'zel increases the damage of all Champions in her column, including herself.
raw.name: Lethal Coordination

description.desc: $source increases the damage of all Champions in her column by $(amount)%, including herself.

abilities.desc: Lae'zel increases the damage of all Champions in her column, including herself.

abilities.name: Ceremorphosis

description.desc: Your formation gains one Ceremorphosis stack due to the mind flayer tadpole in $source's brain. $source increases the effect of $(upgrade_name id___2) by $(amount)% for each Ceremorphosis stack, stacking multiplicatively.

abilities.desc: Your formation gains one Ceremorphosis stack due to the mind flayer tadpole in Lae'zel's brain. Lae'zel increases the effect of Lethal Coordination by 100% for each Ceremorphosis stack, stacking multiplicatively.

abilities.name: Straight to the Point

raw.tip_text: Lae'zel gets impatient when other Champions defeat enemies which results in her complete areas early.
raw.name: Straight to the Point

description.desc: In non-boss areas, whenever an enemy is defeated by anything OTHER than $source, she has a $(amount)% chance to gain an Impatience stack. When she has $(max_stacks___2) Impatience stacks, complete the current area and reset the Impatience stacks to the current Ceremorphosis count. Stacks persist when changing areas.

abilities.desc: Lae'zel gets impatient when other Champions defeat enemies which results in her complete areas early.

abilities.name: Aberration Hunter

description.desc: Aberrations are $source's Favored Foe. Every time an Aberration spawns, $source's $(upgrade_name id___2) is multiplicatively increased by $(not_buffed amount___2)%, stacking up to $(max_stack_mult___3) times the Ceremorphosis stack count and resetting when changing areas. There is a $(amount___4)% chance with each wave in a non-boss area that an extra Mind Flayer spawns.

abilities.desc: Aberrations are Lae'zel's Favored Foe. Every time an Aberration spawns, Lae'zel's Lethal Coordination is multiplicatively increased by 100%, stacking up to 4 times the Ceremorphosis stack count and resetting when changing areas. There is a 33% chance with each wave in a non-boss area that an extra Mind Flayer spawns.

abilities.name: Ferocious Warrior

description.desc: If $source attacks and any of her targets survive, her base attack cooldown for her next attack is reduced by $(amount) seconds.

abilities.desc: If Lae'zel attacks and any of her targets survive, her base attack cooldown for her next attack is reduced by 4 seconds.

specs.name: Battle Master

raw.name: Battle Master
raw.specialization_description: Lae'zel's attacks distract enemies, causing the next attack that hits them to do massive damage.

description.desc: When $source hits an enemy and they survive, the enemy is distracted and the next Champion (other than $source) that hits them deals an additional $(amount) seconds of BUD-based damage.

specs.desc: When Lae'zel hits an enemy and they survive, the enemy is distracted and the next Champion (other than Lae'zel) that hits them deals an additional 4 seconds of BUD-based damage.

specs.name: Champion

raw.name: Champion
raw.specialization_description: Lae'zel becomes a Champion, increasing the chance and damage of her critical hits.

description.desc: Increases $source's Critical Hit chance by $(amount)% (additively) and Critical Hit damage by $(amount___2)% (multiplicatively).

specs.desc: Increases Lae'zel's Critical Hit chance by 20% (additively) and Critical Hit damage by 100% (multiplicatively).

specs.name: Eldritch Knight

raw.name: Eldritch Knight
raw.specialization_description: Lae'zel becomes an Eldritch Knight, allowing her to cast Magic Missile after each of her Greatsword attacks.

description.desc: $source now casts Magic Missile immediately after attacking with her greatsword, firing a missile at 3 random targets.

specs.desc: Lae'zel now casts Magic Missile immediately after attacking with her greatsword, firing a missile at 3 random targets.

ult.description: Lae'zel leaps into the enemies and attacks, stunning them all for a short duration.
ult.long_description: Lae'zel psionically leaps into the enemies and attacks with a psionic shockwave, stunning them all for a short duration.
ult.name: Psionic Leap

base.description: Lae'zel attacks the closest enemies with a swing of her greatsword.
base.name: Greatsword

effects: Increases the damage of all Champions by 10% for each Champion in the formation.
Increases the damage of all Female Champions by 125%.
Increases the damage of all Githyanki Champions by 150%.
Increases the damage of all Champions by 20% for each Champion with a INT score of 11 or higher in the formation.
Increases the damage of all Champions by 30% for each Champion with a DEX score of 13 or higher in the formation.
Increases the damage of all Champions by 20% for each Melee Champion in the formation.

data.name: Lae'zel

items.name: Raiding Daggers
items.description: A gift from my sa'varsh. I used them to survive my first of many raids.

items.name: Balanced Blades
items.description: A fellow initiate called these blades 'insufficient'. The wounds they left on his forehead prove otherwise.

items.name: Ghaik Slayer
items.description: This will help me bring a ghaik head to my Undying Queen.

items.name: Mind Seeker
items.description: Each bolt is enchanted to seek out the brain of a ghaik and destroy it.

items.name: Training Weapon
items.description: The edge may be dull, but it will cleave my foes open all the same.

items.name: Battle Damaged Sword
items.description: Each mark on this blade is a lesson I learned on Crèche K'liir.

items.name: Greatsword
items.description: One day I will wield a true silver sword in Vlaakith's name.

items.name: Githyanki Silver Sword
items.description: Within this blade lives the whole of the empire's might!

items.name: Raiding Prize
items.description: A mere trinket.

items.name: Memory of the Tears
items.description: A simple memento of the crèche I once called home.

items.name: Aether Shards
items.description: Said to be found only in Tu'narath, the City of Death.

items.name: Token of Vlaakith
items.description: The engraving on the back reads: 'Vlaakith'ka sivim hrath krash'ht'

items.name: Ornate Garb
items.description: Discarded attire from Crèche K'liir - a hand-me-down from the varsh.

items.name: Ancient Adornment
items.description: Ceremonial garments, passed from the undead tl'a'ikith who wore them in life.

items.name: Githyanki Mail
items.description: The armor of a githyanki warrior is unmatched.

items.name: Dragonrider Armour
items.description: To wear this armour atop a red dragon steed is my duty and my destiny!

items.name: Leather Sandals
items.description: Tsk'va! I hate these things.

items.name: Well Used Sandals
items.description: Training on Crèche K'liir with these was close to torture.

items.name: Half Plate Boots
items.description: With one sturdy stomp, I could crush a ghaik's abominable skull.

items.name: Astral Striders
items.description: With these, I can walk amongst the stars and hunt ghaik wherever they hide.

items.name: Unidentified Crown
items.description: I snatched this from the ruins of a githyanki temple. It holds but a trace of psionic magic.

items.name: Ancient Crown
items.description: The magic within this crown reeks of shadow. I call upon it at my own peril.

items.name: Gloves of Missile Snaring
items.description: The spoils of a victorious raid. They serve their purpose more than adequately.

items.name: Sunwalker's Gift
items.description: With this, the shadows bow to me.

data.backstory: Astarion prowled the night as a vampire spawn for centuries, serving a sadistic master until he was snatched away. Now he can walk in the light and has the chance at a new life, but how long can he keep his past buried?

abilities.name: Vampire Spawn

description.desc: Astarion counts as "dead" for the purposes of effects that care about dead Champions, but "alive" for all other purposes.

abilities.desc: Astarion counts as "dead" for the purposes of effects that care about dead Champions, but "alive" for all other purposes.

abilities.name: Ceremorphosis

description.desc: Your formation gains one Ceremorphosis stack due to the mind flayer tadpole in Astarion's brain. Astarion increases the effect of Outflank by $(amount)% for each Ceremorphosis stack, stacking multiplicatively.

abilities.desc: Your formation gains one Ceremorphosis stack due to the mind flayer tadpole in Astarion's brain. Astarion increases the effect of Outflank by 100% for each Ceremorphosis stack, stacking multiplicatively.

abilities.name: Generational Wealth

description.desc: Astarion increases the gold find of the formation by $(amount)% multiplied by the total age of all Champions in the formation.

abilities.desc: Astarion increases the gold find of the formation by 1% multiplied by the total age of all Champions in the formation.

abilities.name: Well Fed

description.desc: After using his Sanguine Hunger ultimate, Astarion's Outflank is increased by $(amount)%. This effect can stack (multiplicatively) up to 5 times, with stacks resetting when changing areas.

abilities.desc: After using his Sanguine Hunger ultimate, Astarion's Outflank is increased by 400%. This effect can stack (multiplicatively) up to 5 times, with stacks resetting when changing areas.

abilities.name: The Ultimate Outflank

raw.tip_text: Astarion reduces ultimate cooldowns of other Champions when he uses his ultimate if he is buffed by his own Outflank ability.
raw.name: The Ultimate Outflank

description.desc: If Astarion is buffed by his own Outflank ability, when he uses his Sanguine Hunger Ultimate attack, he reduces the active ultimate cooldown of all other Champions in the formation by $(amount)%.

abilities.desc: Astarion reduces ultimate cooldowns of other Champions when he uses his ultimate if he is buffed by his own Outflank ability.

specs.name: Outflank (Bottom)

raw.specialization_description: Astarion looks to the bottom of the formation to deal the most damage.

description.desc: Astarion increases the damage of all Champions at the bottom of each column by $(amount)%

specs.desc: Astarion increases the damage of all Champions at the bottom of each column by 100%.

specs.name: Outflank (Top)

raw.tip_text: Astarion increases the damage of all champions on either the top or the bottom of each column, based on your choice.

raw.specialization_description: Astarion looks to the top of the formation to deal the most damage.

description.desc: Astarion increases the damage of all Champions at the top of each column by $(amount)%.

specs.desc: Astarion increases the damage of all Champions at the top of each column by 100%.

specs.name: Arcane Trickster

raw.name: Arcane Trickster
raw.specialization_description: Astarion works best with fellow rogues, wizards, and Absolute Adversaries affiliation members.

description.desc: Astarion increases the damage bonus of his Outflank specialization by $(amount)% for each Champion in the formation that is a Rogue, Wizard, or Absolute Adversaries affiliation member, stacking multiplicatively.

specs.desc: Astarion increases the damage bonus of his Outflank specialization by 100% for each Champion in the formation that is a Rogue, Wizard, or Absolute Adversaries affiliation member, stacking multiplicatively.

specs.name: Assassin

raw.name: Assassin
raw.specialization_description: Astarion focuses on dealing more damage when he attacks an enemy who has been recently attacked by an ally.

description.desc: Increases the bonus BUD-based damage Astarion's Sneak Attack deals to $(amount) seconds worth.

specs.desc: Increases the bonus BUD-based damage Astarion's Sneak Attack deals to 5 seconds worth.

specs.name: Thief

raw.name: Thief
raw.specialization_description: Astarion schemes with other gold find Champions in the formation to "obtain" even more gold.

description.desc: Astarion increases the gold find of the party by $(amount)% for each gold find Champion in the formation, stacking multiplicatively.

specs.desc: Astarion increases the gold find of the party by 100% for each gold find Champion in the formation, stacking multiplicatively.

ult.description: Astarion viciously attacks the enemy with the most health and heals to full health.
ult.long_description: Astarion viciously attacks the enemy with the most health with a vampiric bite and heals to full health.
ult.name: Sanguine Hunger

base.description: Astarion attacks a random target, dealing massive damage if the enemy was recently attacked.
base.name: Sneak Attack

effects: Increases the damage of all Champions by 100%.
Increases the damage of all Champions by 20% for each Male Champion in the formation.
Increases the damage of all Champions by 45% for each Elf Champion in the formation.
Increases the damage of all Champions with a INT score of 13 or higher by 150%.
Increases the damage of all Champions with a CON score of 11 or higher by 100%.

items.name: Gutter Sling
items.description: I found this in a gutter. It may look disgusting, but it's deadly. ...to rats.

items.name: Handmade Sling
items.description: It won't take down an owlbear, but perhaps a kobold? If the wind is right...

items.name: Infernal Blades
items.description: Don't ask where these came from, you don't want to know.

items.name: Nightfang Bow
items.description: Showy AND deadly? Oh it's perfect, darling!

items.name: Nautiloid Schematics
items.description: The others don't need to know I have this. It's for my own ...research.

items.name: Note-Filled Illustration
items.description: These have been fascinating. I think I'm getting closer to something...

items.name: Tome of the Illithid
items.description: Could it work? It shouldn't be possible. None of this should be possible...

items.name: Eldritch Experiment
items.description: If this goes the way I hope -- I'll never have to fear the sun again.

items.name: Baldur's Gate Map
items.description: This is one of my few possessions now that I serve Cazador...

items.name: Outdated Diagram
items.description: This used to be accurate. Now it feels more like an ancient painting than a map.

items.name: Twisted Lock Picks
items.description: I've been told these will never break. I'll put that to the test.

items.name: Forged Patents of Nobility
items.description: No one will question my nobility now. Or they shouldn't for the coin I paid.

items.name: The First of Many
items.description: Well, that was... disgusting.

items.name: Quick Snack
items.description: It may not be dignified, but needs must.

items.name: Broken Silver Mirror
items.description: Someday I'll see my face again. You're lucky enough to see it every day.

items.name: Cazador Szarr Portrait
items.description: Did you ever hate something so much, you just couldn't part with it?

items.name: Throwing Dagger
items.description: Better than a sling, that's for sure.

items.name: Balanced Blade
items.description: I'm much better with these than I expected. I'll have to get them enchanted...

items.name: Noble's Sword
items.description: Yes, this is mine. No, you don't need to know where I got it.

items.name: Vampiric Rapier
items.description: They'll lose the blood regardless. This just happens to save it for me.

items.name: Ring of Protection
items.description: I picked up this little treasure with the coin I made from OnlyFangs.

items.name: Dispelled Ring
items.description: Well, it was good while it lasted.

items.name: Smuggler's Ring
items.description: Tav gave this to me and said it would suit me well. They were right.

items.name: Amulet of Misty Step
items.description: Stabbing your enemies gets much easier when you can simply appear behind them.

data.backstory: Commodore Krux is a giff soldier who believes his glory days are behind him. Krux has spent the last few years working as a mercenary on and around the Rock of Bral, but lately the giff has been spending more time in his cups as new jobs have become fewer and farther between.

abilities.name: Wildspace Lover

description.desc: Commodore Krux can be used in any Light of Xaryxis campaign adventure or variant, even if he would not normally be available to be used due to variant or patron restrictions.

abilities.desc: Commodore Krux can be used in any Light of Xaryxis campaign adventure or variant, even if he would not normally be available to be used due to variant or patron restrictions.

abilities.name: All Hands On Deck!

raw.tip_text: Commodore Krux buffs Champions who are in his column and the back column of the formation.
raw.name: All Hands On Deck!

conditions.desc: Commodore Krux increases the damage of all Champions in his column and the two rear-most columns of the formation by $(amount)%. This does not apply twice if he's in one of the two rear-most columns.
Commodore Krux increases the damage of all Champions in his column and the rear-most column of the formation by $(amount)%. This does not apply twice if that is the same column.

abilities.desc: Commodore Krux buffs Champions who are in his column and the back column of the formation.

abilities.name: Starfarer's Spyglass

raw.tip_text: Commodore Krux is always looking ahead and chooses a Favored Foe from the next area when completing an area.
raw.name: Starfarer's Spyglass

conditions.desc: ^^$(krux_starfarers_spyglass)

description.desc: Upon completing a new area, Commodore Krux raises a spyglass to his eye and spots an enemy from the next area. All enemies of that type become his Favored Foe (until another area is completed) and take $(amount)% more damage from all sources.

abilities.desc: Commodore Krux is always looking ahead and chooses a Favored Foe from the next area when completing an area.

ult.description: Commodore Krux throws a grenade at the enemy with the most health which deals damage and knocks enemies back.
ult.long_description: Commodore Krux throws a grenade at the enemy with the most health, which explodes dealing ultimate damage to all enemies in a medium radius and knocking them all back a short distance.
ult.name: Force Grenade

base.description: Commodore Krux fires a pistol at a random target.
base.name: Flintlock Pistols

items.name: Sailor's Clothes
items.description: Ah yes, been a few years since I fit into this one.

items.name: Shipmate Uniform
items.description: Smell that? Still smells like my old ship. Good memories.

items.name: Commodore Attire
items.description: On the Second Wind I get to choose my own uniform!

items.name: Warlord Armor
items.description: Haha! Nothing can stop me in this!

items.name: Flimsy Firearms
items.description: I remember these being much sturdier...

items.name: Reinforced Pistols
items.description: Oh, no, I was thinking of these. These were good weapons!

items.name: Dueling Muskets
items.description: I took these in a duel. No one lost, but they were too drunk to notice.

items.name: Muskets of Precision
items.description: Won these in a game at Infinity's. That celestial was not happy with me...

items.name: Empty Coin Purse
items.description: Oh dear, it seems there's been a hole in this one...

items.name: Unusually Light Pouch
items.description: I swear there were more coins in here this morning

items.name: Secured Purse
items.description: It may be light, but thieves can't easily access it!

items.name: Heavy Bag of Holding
items.description: I can carry most anything in this! There's nothing in it, but I could!

items.name: Terrestrial Sextant
items.description: At one point I sailed the seas and this was always with me.

items.name: Astral Navigator
items.description: I acquired this on a trip to the Radiant Citadel.

items.name: Cosmic Spyglass
items.description: A normal spyglass just won't cut it in Wildspace.

items.name: Wildspace Orrery
items.description: Only a fool would knowingly sail into Doomspace. And I'm that fool!

items.name: Broken Pocket Watch
items.description: This belonged to an old friend. Should I repair it?

items.name: Repaired Pocket Watch
items.description: It's good to hear this ticking away once again.

items.name: Broken Sending Stone
items.description: Warwyck broke this the last time I saw him...

items.name: Tarrasque Tooth
items.description: Few believe me when I tell them the story behind this tooth!

items.name: Dirty Flatcap
items.description: Wore this one down to the threads it seems.

items.name: Tailored Flatcap
items.description: Well, this WAS tailored.

items.name: Red Beret
items.description: Found this one floating out in Wildspace. I'm sure it's fine.

items.name: Armored Top Hat
items.description: Wish I had this when I found that Tarrasque...

data.backstory:
Omin's Daughter - apparently. Possibly a new member of Acquisitions Incorporated affiliation and in time for their season.

Info from a wiki.
> Certainty Dran is the Head Secretarian at Acquisitions Incorporated headquarters. She communicates with other franchise teams through their documancy ledgers, passing on orders from Omin Dran, who also happens to be her father.

[Wiki Link](https://acquisitionsincorporated.fandom.com/wiki/Certainty_Dran)

abilities.name: Secretarian's Advice
abilities.desc: Certainty increases the damage of Champions in the column in front of her by 100%.

abilities.name: Reboot Expert
abilities.desc: Certainty increases the effect of Secretarian's Advice by 100% each time she has been in an adventure for at least 250 areas when it is reset. This stacks additively and persists through resets.

abilities.name: Financing Rounds
abilities.desc: Certainty increases the effect of Secretarian's Advice and your Gold Find by 1% for each level on Acquisitions Incorporated or 'C' Team Champions in the formation, stacking additively. Each Champion's contribution caps at 1000 levels after their last available upgrade.

abilities.name: Dad and Uncle Jim
abilities.desc: Certainty helps her father Omin by recruiting all Champions adjacent to her to be Champions of Tymora, and she helps her 'uncle' Jim Darkmagic by increasing his damage by 200% due to royalty payments for using his spell.

abilities.name: Employee Evaluations
abilities.desc: Certainty assesses the average score of her preferred ability (INT or CHA) of the Champions in the column in front of her and increases the damage effect of Secretarian's Advice by 200% for each full point over 13, stacking multiplicatively.

specs.name: Specialisation: Best and the Brightest
specs.desc: Certainty's preferred ability is Intelligence and she grants a +1 INT bonus to all Champions in the column in front of her.

specs.name: Specialisation: Smooth Negotiators
specs.desc: Certainty's preferred ability is Charisma and she grants a +1 CHA bonus to all Champions in the column in front of her.

specs.name: Specialisation: Employee Evaluations
specs.desc: Certainty assesses the average score of her preferred ability (INT or CHA) of the Champions in the column in front of her and increases the damage effect of Secretarian's Advice by 200% for each full point over 13, stacking multiplicatively.

ult.description: A barrage of fire from Certainty's enlarged toy airship flings up to 10 enemies off the screen.
ult.long_description: A barrage of fire from Certainty's enlarged toy airship flings up to 10 enemies off the screen.
ult.name: Airship Attack

base.description: Certainty attacks random enemies with a version of Jim's patented magic missile spell.
base.name: Jim's Magic Missile

data.name: Certainty Dran

data.backstory: We currently know very little about this champion. We believe they will be part of the next (and sixth) Idle Champions Presents: `Fatebreaker`.

abilities.name: Plateaus of Unicorn
abilities.desc: Unknown.

abilities.name: Strength of the Luma
abilities.desc: Thellora increases the damage of Champions in the column behind her by 100%.

abilities.name: Radiance of the Sky Cents
abilities.desc: Thellora increases the health of all other Champions by 25% of her max health and any healing effect on those Champions is increased by 25%.

abilities.name: Paladin's Resolve
abilities.desc: Each time Thellora attacks and doesn't kill an enemy, she increases the effect of Strength of the Luma by 20% until the area changes, stacking multiplicatively and capped at 100 stacks.

abilities.name: Feats to Spare
abilities.desc: The effects of feats assigned to Thellora also apply to all adjacent Champions. Note that feats that buff her formation abilities have no effect when applied to other Champions.

specs.name: Specialisation: Defender of the Meek
specs.desc: Thellora increases the damage of Champions with a STR of 12 or less by 60% for each Champion in the formation with a STR of 12 or less, stacking multiplicatively. Buffs apply to the pre-stack value.

specs.name: Specialisation: Vanguard of the Quick
specs.desc: Thellora increases the damage of Speed Champions by 50% for each Speed Champion in the formation, stacking multiplicatively. Buffs apply to the pre-stack value.

specs.name: Specialisation: Callessas Blessed
specs.desc: Thellora increases the damage of Female and Non-Binary Champions by 50% for each Female and Non-Binary Champion in the formation, stacking multiplicatively. Buffs apply to the pre-stack value.

ult.description: Thellora charges through the enemies, and then increases the damage of all champions for a short while.
ult.long_description: Thellora charges through the enemies dealing 1 massive hit to enemies in a wide path, and then increases the damage of all champions for a short while.
ult.name: The Light of Mount Tura

base.description: Thellora strikes an enemy with her hooves, and another with her blade.
base.name: Windsong's Strike
